content.raw:
This std::map version makes the assumption that if the passed in `CollisionPtr`s  are not null then they are valid collisions. Otherwise, it uses the same strategy as the std::vector version to look-up collision by name later in `NewContact`.  

I did this because it was kind of strange to let users pass in `CollisionPtr`s but then they are not used. If I were the user I would expect this function call to be more efficient then calling the std::vector one given that more information are available. It's a nice convenient method though.
content.html:
This std::map version makes the assumption that if the passed in CollisionPtrs are not null then they are valid collisions. Otherwise, it uses the same strategy as the std::vector version to look-up collision by name later in NewContact.

I did this because it was kind of strange to let users pass in CollisionPtrs but then they are not used. If I were the user I would expect this function call to be more efficient then calling the std::vector one given that more information are available. It's a nice convenient method though.
